alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 7:21PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lassen County through 800 PM PDT... At 720 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eagle Lake, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eagle Lake, Spaulding, Christie Campground and Merrill Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
